maths.name: Least Common Multiples (LCMs) - Part 1
maths.synopsis: A common multiple of two whole numbers a and b is a number c which a and b both divide into evenly.

maths.name: Least Common Multiples (LCMs) - Part 2
maths.synopsis: Another way to find the LCM of two numbers is to divide their product by their greatest common factor ( GCF ).

maths.name: Adding Fractions with Unlike Denominators
maths.synopsis: If the denominators are not the same, then you have to use equivalent fractions which do have a common denominator.
